polished_script:
HOOK: Your content is invisible because you're copying Google. [ON-SCREEN: Your content is invisible]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You're posting market stats, interest rate updates, home buying tips. Zero comments. Zero calls. Because your audience didn't need YOU for information they could Google in ten seconds. [ON-SCREEN: Market stats + interest rates + tips = crickets]
  [15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what the agents getting calls do differently.

INSIGHT: Kim Rittberg works with top producers, and she's blunt about this: "Everyone has Google. Everyone has access to you. Don't just take the phone to the internet and say it. Really think about what is YOUR opinion, what is YOUR take?" [ON-SCREEN: Don't just repeat Google] Here's what that looks like: When rates drop, don't just announce it â€” tell people if NOW is the time to buy or wait. When a house sits ninety days, don't just share it â€” explain WHY it's sitting and what that means for buyers in that neighborhood. [ON-SCREEN: Give YOUR take, not Google's]

REFRAME: The agents getting calls aren't posting the most. They're posting with a point of view. Because people don't hire information â€” they hire perspective. [ON-SCREEN: People hire perspective, not information]

CTA: "Look at your last post right now â€” could someone have Googled it in ten seconds?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---
